appliedUpdates.description: Fixed import verification guidance in user-testing.md: changed from root-level `bun -e "import '@outfitter/...'"` (which fails in this monorepo) to package-local verification via `cd packages/<pkg> && bun -e "import './src/index.ts'"`. Also noted format:fix crash alongside check crash.
Added normalize-exports build pipeline documentation to architecture.md explaining that bunup auto-mutates package.json export maps during build.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Fix library-worker skill: remove `bun run check` from example handoff since the procedural text already warns against using it (tokio panic). The contradictory guidance confused 3/5 workers in this milestone.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Reviews for os-333-wrap-error, os-334-result-from-fetch, and os-291-shared-deps-result all flagged the same contradiction: SKILL.md line ~64 says 'Do NOT use bun run check' but example handoff at line ~122 includes it as a successful command.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Update library-worker skill export verification to use package-local imports instead of root-level workspace imports. Change `bun -e "const m = await import('@outfitter/<pkg>')..."` to `cd packages/<pkg> && bun -e "const m = await import('./src/index.ts')..."` since workspace package resolution doesn't work from repo root with `bun -e`.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Reviews for os-332-parse-input, os-334-result-from-fetch, and os-335-expect-ok-err all report the same failure: root-level import verification fails with 'Cannot find module @outfitter/contracts'. Workers had to independently discover the package-local fallback.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Document non-interactive changeset creation in library-worker skill. Workers in exec mode cannot run interactive `bun changeset` and must directly create `.changeset/<name>.md` files. Add a note or example showing the direct file creation approach.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Review for os-332-parse-input observed that worker created changeset file directly via file creation tool rather than running `bun changeset` as prescribed by the skill.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Add `bun run format:fix` to the list of commands that crash with tokio panic, alongside `bun run check` and `bun run format:check`. Workers should use `bun run lint` and `bun run typecheck` separately for validation.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Review for os-291-shared-deps-result reports that worker transcript explicitly notes `bun run format:fix` crashed with `tokio-runtime-worker panicked`, but mission AGENTS.md only documents the crash for `bun run check`/`format:check`.
